text:
Kalau kamu menginginkan tipe penginapan yang lain dari biasanya di Bali, kamu harus coba menginap di Sandat Glamping Tents. Penginapan satu ini menawarkan konsep istirahat dengan nuansa kemah dalam tenda yang tidak mengabaikan kenyamanan, kemewahan, dan tentunya pelayanan hotel. Konsep penginapan di tempat ini bukan hanya konsep berkemah namun juga menginap di lumbung padi. Wah, bagaimana rasanya menginap di dalam lumbung padi ya?

Keunikan lain yang akan kamu temukan di hotel ini adalah komponen bangunan yang menggunakan bahan dasar alam seperti batu-batuan serta bambu. Setiap tenda dan lumbung yang menjadi tipe kamar mereka bahkan memiliki desain yang berbeda satu sama lainnya. Kalau kamu ingin berbulan madu di sini, pastikan kamu memilih tipe tenda karena di teras belakang akan tersedia fasilitas candle light dinner super romantis yang menorehkan pengalaman tak terlupakan bersama pasangan.
title: suke bangat , asyik sekali

text: Tempatnya Memang Tersembunyi di tengah persawahan, akses jalan nya cukup untuk 1 mobil dan jalannya sedikit off road, tetapi begitu masuk suasana nya sangat nyaman, tenda dan lumbung yang di sediakan tidak begitu banyak, jadi tamu yang menginap tidak banyak namun di situlah uniknya, untuk yang sedang ingin menenangkan diri dari keramaian (orang banyak) ataupun untuk honeymoon yang hanya ingin berduaan saja, sandat glamping adalah tempat yang recomended, tidak ada TV dan Telfon di Kamar yang ada hanya kulkas dan hairdryer, lampu pun hanya berada di tenda saja, dan selebihnya hanya lilin yang menerangi jalanan menuju tenda begitu romantis, terlihat jelas bintang2 bertaburan memenuhi langit kebetulan saat itu sedang bulan purnama menambah apik penampilan langit dan hanya suara jangkrik yang terdengar, sayang saya hanya menghabiskan satu malam di "romantic white tents" karena kami harus melanjutkan perjalanan, saat kami menginap di sana sikat gigi dan odol tidak di sediakan sebaiknya pihak sandat glamping menyediakannya, sistem cek in dan cek out masih manual (tidak ada komputer) petugas hotel sempat salah menghitung kurs dolar (kami membayar dengan rupiah) dan biaya kamar kami sempat selisih kurang lebih satu juta karena hanya salah hitung, sebaiknya sandat membuat sistim pembayaran dengan komputer agar tidak terjadi lagi kepada tamu lain.
title: ROMANTIC PLACE

text: We stayed at Sandat in August 2019 for  5 days and we absolutely loved it. Staff was very  attentive and helpfull , food was amazing ( lots of Italian dishes ) and we felt really spoilt. text:
My partner and I stayed here for one night, and it was incredible, Sandat Glamping offers you a truly unique experience that you would be hard pressed to find anywhere else.

You really get a relaxed vide from the place, and the tents are awesome, well equipped and cosy with great bathrooms! They even have their own aircon! Now that is glamping! Not to mention the amazing infinity pool, the whole tent is very private also.

The food was amazing, (great vegetarian options) and the staff were awesome. The manager, i think his name was Tepang or something similar, was so friendly and very welcoming.

If you want to relax this is the place, if you want to instagram, this is the place, if you want luxurious glamping, this is the place!

10/10
title: AMAZING EXPERIENCE & A MUST DO!

text:
I’m an American who has stayed in Bali about 5 times. This is one of the top places I’ve stayed. My partner and I really enjoyed it. 

Lovely and quiet bungalows give a serene and private experience. Our little pool was also great. 

The overall resort is well designed and beautiful, with a pleasant restaurant and yoga studio. 

Owners and staff were friendly and accommodating. Delicious food and nice drinks at the restaurant!

I would encourage people to stay here who don’t want to be stuck in the busy center of Ubud. It’s a quiet atmosphere designed for those who want to truly get away from it all :)
title: One of my favorite Ubud getaways

text:
Sandat Glamping looks exactly like the pictures.  Absolutely beautiful.   BUT it is not 5 star. It is difficult to write a review on this property as it is visually lovely, but at the end of the day it is just a pretty tent with its own pool and not worth the high price they charge. 

Arriving at Sandat was a real let down.  We drove down a dirt road that was surrounded by weeds and derelict buildings, not lush rice fields.
 
The main reason we came to Sandat was for peace & quiet.  Instead we were woken at 4:30am by roosters surrounding our tent and construction work happening at neighbouring properties.

Whilst the overall presentation of the property is beautiful, on closer inspection the tents, decks, pools need attention.  The deck surrounding the pool was in poor condition with a lot of rotted out timber which you had to be careful walking on.  The tent roof internally is covered in mouldy dark patches.  The hot water for the shower runs out in 3 minutes and the beds are like rock. There is also a safe in the room but you can not select your own PIN, that staff tell you what it is.  Not safe at all.

For a 5 star property paying over $400AUD a night there should be bath robes, slippers, milk in the fridge, an international power adaptor, changed towels daily.
Their idea of using a xylophone to call room service is a lovely idea but the staff don't hear it and you end up walking to reception/bar yourself each time.  

The first night we stayed in the Banten Tent.  Unfortunately this tent is at the boundary of the property with construction work next door and atleast 5 - 10 roosters.  This meant we were woken at 4:30am due to the constant noise.
The staff were lovely and moved us to another tent and gave us 2 free massages for the inconvenience. They moved us to the Oogh tent but this was right next to the restaurant which then meant it was noisy late at night and early in the morning. 

We had booked for 5 nights and requested a refund for the last 2 nights to stay somewhere else.  The email response from the owners (Italians that live in Italy) was basically too bad, we cant do anything about whats happening with the construction and the roosters should we a welcome sound as this is the nature of Bali.  This is kind of a fair response but its not like we asked for a refund of the whole trip.  

In the end we left 2 nights early (no refund) and stayed elsewhere.   

If you want 5 Star quiet accommodation don't stay here.  If you want to stay in a pretty tent and happy to be awake at 4:30am each morning and listen to construction work all day, give it a try.
title: Beautiful BUT mixed feelings.

text:
Sadly we were only here for 1 night before heading home so we did not get to enjoy the grounds and tent a little more.

It was the beginning of the wet season when we stayed so it rained almost non-stop since we arrived, however we used this time to relax and enjoy what we could.

The full body massage I received upon arrival was amazing! The tents are very glam and well fitted out with everything you need. We woke to the sounds of the jungle (if you are a light sleeper this may keep you awake) and the coolness from the rain which was steady all night. This can cause the tent to become a little cool snd damp so we just kept our suitcases closed and any books/papers in our cases.

It's extremely private and the staff are particularly aware of guests privacy by not entering your tents area without making themselves known first. They will not enter the area without your permission.

The food is of Mediterranean fare and is delicious. The little extras on top of each meal were unexpected and amazing.

If you are looking for something private, intimate, fancy and unique, this is your place.

Free shuttle into Ubud center makes getting around much easier too.

text: I stayed here on part 2 on our Honeymoon in Bali. Was in a beautiful, rice paddy location, tucked away from Ubud. The resort still offered a convenient shuttle service to get you quickly into the town centre. My highest compliments go to the design of the resort. It has a really unique aesthetic without which blows you away on arrival. The dining room is placed under an enormous bamboo structure, complete with bar, sofas and half tree table. The 'tents' are sequestered away deeper into the foliage, ours came with a nice decking area and refreshing plunge pool. The tents themselves had all the amenities you could hope for from a more permanent structure. The air/con is effective once you fold down the plastic flaps. The tent has solid wood flooring and good plumbing so this is very far removed from a true camping experience. The food at the restaraunt was pretty good, the menu was quite limited a few generic Asian dishes and some plain pastas but all was perfectly decent. I would say the service was a little overkill at times, its a small resort and we found ourselves to be the only people eating in the restaraunt at times. I often felt we were being watched a bit too much. By-the-by though, the overall experience was great and I'd recommend to anyone wanting to spend some time in Ubud but get away from the business at night.

text:
This place blew me away so much I had to make a trip advisor account just so I could leave a review.
Stayed here for 4 nights with my boyfriend for my birthday as part of a 2 week trip to Bali and this was the highlight by far. It's located a 10/15 min drive away from Ubud town in the middle of rice fields offering you a calm setting away from the busy streets of Ubud.
The accommodation feels so much more luxurious than your typical hotel, with the sounds of the jungle as you sleep and your own private pool to lie by all day.
The staff were all so friendly and helpful and there is also a free shuttle to take you to and from Ubud all day until 10pm.
On our last night we chose to have dinner here, opting for the 'romantic dinner' which is a candlelit dinner outside your tent, perfect way to end the holiday, and the food was fantastic.

Can't recommend this place enough, not a bad word to say!
title: Paradise

text: Sandat Glamping was without a doubt the highlight of our honeymoon. I have never stayed in a more perfect place where every small detail has been carefully thought out. The decor is straight out of a magazine, except better, the staff are the most lovely, considerate and attentive people that have ever come into contact with. The hotel offers everything you could possibly need from morning yoga sessions on site to massages in your room and some of the best meals we had in all of Indonesia. We also had a tour organized by the wonderful Wayan to do some shopping in Tegalalang and see the rice terraces. The breakfast is perfect and the smiles are plentiful. My compliments to the owners for having chosen a slice of paradise and creating a much needed oasis outside of the chaotic tourist trappings of Ubud. I hope to come back someday!

text: We had a lovely time at Sandat, the bamboo glamping structures were amazing and beautifully decorated in both the room and restaurant area. We stayed 2 nights and could have stayed much longer! The staff were so friendly and helpful - my luggage was delayed on arrival to Bali, and waiting for me longer at the airport was not any trouble for the driver. The staff also helped me communicate with airport staff in locating my bag. The pool area was peaceful and the staff were always on hand bringing over complementary iced water. The food was delicious, and they catered for my dietary requirements at breakfast with plenty of options.  The free local shuttle was a good touch as it located a little way out of Ubud center set in the rice fields. Would highly recommend Sandat!
title: Beautiful and relaxing glamping experience

text:
We booked Sandat Glamping as our first stop for our honeymoon in Bali. We originally found out about this place through Secret Escapes and then we decided to go direct as it worked out cheaper.
We arrived pretty late, around 2am but we had reception arrange an airport transfer for us. The driver was friendly and helpful and the vehicle was comfortable which had good air conditioning for the hour drive from the airport. 
Aside from the amazing landscape of the accommodation, the staff are their most important asset which for us was important as it was our honeymoon and we wanted to feel welcomed and a little special. Reception staff were always smily and friendly and readily offered advice or suggestions on places to visit with indication on prices. 
As we booked direct we were given 1 complimentary hour massage for 1 person. We then paid for an extra massage as there were two of us. It cost around 225,000 rupiah which is roughly £13. You can find cheaper in Ubud town but the comfort and convenience of having it at the lounge area of your barn makes up for the extra you're paying. 
Breakfast is included and they serve until 11.30am which was great for us as we're late risers. Service was always friendly and attentive and were happy to make any specific breakfast requests (scrambled eggs, omlette etc).
We had dinner here twice and both times the food was lovely. 
Rooms and bathrooms are cleaned everyday with new towels and sheets. The mosquito net worked really well during the nights. Do not keep the balcony doors open if you do not want to get bitten. 
The communal swimming pool for the Lumbung rice barns was great. Good size and most of the time we were the only ones using it. 
The site is a 10-15 minute drive from central Ubud. It's not a workable distance but reception provide a free shuttle service every hour to the centre. They can also pick you up if you WhatsApp them and let them know in advance. Shuttle only runs until 10pm. If you plan to stay later than that, then you can get a taxi back. As it'll be much later, it'll be quicker to get back and shouldn't cost you more than 80,000 rupiah which is roughly £5. You have to barter unless you can't be bothered. As the road gets quite bumpy once you get over the bridge and drive through the paddy fields, you may have to direct the driver at night. 
You can probably cover the Ubud area and its sights in about 5 days. They can arrange a day trip to cover several sights for around 800,000 rupiah. It is more expensive than what is available in Ubud but it's quite convenient and we also knew the driver, but it is up to you. 
As it's really hot at this time of year you will need a taxi or a scooter to get around. But do have a walk around the surrounding  paddy fields. 
It's a beautiful and unusual place to stay. We would definitely go back.
title: Tropical Haven in a Paddy Field

text:
The road to Sandat is not paved and I was a little skeptical as we jolted down the path.
Upon arrival the Sandat is beautiful, surrounded by jungle on one side and rice fields on the other.

We stayed in one of the tents and it was fun, but you really have to be close to your travel partner.
The toilet is only separated from the rest of the tent by a curtain.
Also the round bed is rather small for two people.

The private pool was great and the sun beds very comfortable.

If you don’t like camping, book this. It is as far away from it as you can get but you’re still able to call it camping. :-)
title: In the nature

text:
As many other reviewers have said before, this place is really nothing short of amazing.  It starts when you drive up and are greeted with the warmest welcome and literally a crew of people appear to help with your bags, bring them to your room, as you sit down with the manager to review all the details of the stay.  You are brought to your room, where you are greeted with a welcome drink and are shown around your "tent".  

But let's be clear, this is really more "glam" than the "camping".... The tent is beautifully appointed with so much care given to the layout and the furniture.  We had our own private outdoor shower and plunge pool overlooking the jungle.  We felt totally secluded and was an amazing recluse outside of the busier Seminyak area we arrived from.  We loved waking up to the sounds of nature - and there were some big thunderstorms during our stay which only added to the majestic experience.

They also do a wonderful job with the restaurant and food - the women in the restaurant are just about the sweetest and nicest you'll ever meet.  They would play and engage with our  4 year old son, and he loved every minute there as a result. The breakfast buffet is excellent - great cappuccino (as result of Italian influence I'm sure) and you can get eggs to order. We ended up eating all of our dinners there during our 3 night stay as well as 1 lunch, since the food was really that good.  Our last night we were in Ubud watching a dance performance until around 9:00 PM but the kitchen was still open when we returned and we were able to get the famous Ubud crispy duck which was a fantastic way to end the trip.

The hotel was great about booking a tour to the Elephant sanctuary (something we very much enjoyed) and we also took advantage of their shuttle to Ubud center.  I think what was nice about the shuttle is that there are no "set" times - you just tell them when you'd like to go and be picked up and it's like your own personal driver.  They also arranged for our transfer to Nusa Dua utilizing the hotel shuttle (paid a small fee - I don't remember how much).  We also did a private yoga session  - overlooking the rice field which was really idyllic as well as massages in our glamping tent, which they can literally arrange with 1 hour notice (no idea how this is possible but it was).  When you'd like something at your tent you ring this bell and someone comes almost instantly.... service in this hotel is next level and they've done a great job training the staff.   

The owners were on site during our stay and they were very hospitable and welcoming - I didn't even realize they were the owners at first I actually thought they were guests!  I only figured it out when I overheard them talking to some other visitors....  I went up to them and told them just how special everything about the experience was.  We would love to check out their other sister location in Italy at some point :)

I'm so happy we booked this place and our only regret would have been to stay a little longer!  Next time!

text:
We came here as the first part of our honeymoon and stayed for 5 nights.

We arranged (with ease) over email for Sandat to pick us up from the airport in Denpassar. This was a bargain for only 450k RP.

They picked us up from the airport, supplied us a complimentary cool box full of water, beers, mini-spirits for the journey.

They provided our first impression of Sandat staff - happy, helpful and caring. Very much continued in this vain for the rest of our stay.

The tents are exactly what they say on the tin - luxury camping. I see some other reviews on here that are negative, but I'll be honest, this is 'camping' - so make sure you research fully if this is for you.

The tents are fantastic. We stayed in the 'ylang-ylang' and had a private pool which overlooked a hill into lush and dense forest/jungle area.

The pool is ideal for cooling down during hot days - we didn't really spend days 'sunbathing' around this pool, it's nicely shaded and it isn't really that kind of place for the sun worshippers. The pool is really there for quick dips and chilling with a drink every now and then!

The tent has a glass front door, but the rest is very solid and well sealed canvas, with an additional inner lining. The walls are mostly thick mesh, creating an effectively sea against the wildlife - which is definitely there!

Our room had air conditioning and a fan. You can pull down additional linen curtains on the sides with mesh only to completely block the view out.

The vegetation is all around your tent and gecko's (you will hear these awesome creatures and their calls at night), butterflies, spiders will all be nearby for you to observe, but have no way of getting in.

If you love nature - you'll love Sandat. Not once did we have any insect or reptile in our tent - mosquitos included! 

The bed is situated so you can take in the oil candles and pool light at night and makes for a lovely sunset view also. The beds are a little hard and the round beds sometimes make it a little tight for space - but this is a very small and minor issue 👍

The shower is minimalist but offers nice warm water when required, ours broke free of its mounting, but was repaired within minutes by the fantastic staff at a time convenient for us.

You can summon staff to your room by using the musical instrument on your door. Each tent has a different instrument so the staff know who is calling. Even when pouring with rain, we heard the staff attending another tent!

The breakfast is included and offers cereals, muffins, cake, toast and cheese to name a few. They serve tea and coffee (the freshest coffee!). More than you'll need to eat!

The eating area is set up to be communal (a long table) but there are single tables if you want something more intimate. The dining area is under a huge bamboo structure with open sides. There isn't a bar area so to speak, but you can order drinks to your room or take them to a cushy sofa in the dining area.

The lunch and dinner menus are the same and are reasonably priced for hotel type prices. The menu is decent in variety, offering Indonesian food and western home comforts for those that want this.

The food is good quality and the dining staff are excellent, attentive without being intrusive.

There is a large bamboo structure near the entrance which overlooks rich fields and this is designated as the yoga area for those that want to chill out. Sessions are held here regularly or on request.

Check the accommodation out on a map and you will see it is set a few minutes outside of Ubud itself. This is a good thing, you are literally surrounded by rice fields - we went for a walk and enjoyed it very much.

The hotel run 2 transport vehicles and although they like to be given some notice, to be honest they were always more than happy to take us to Ubud with a minutes notice! You can be dropped off at 2 points in Ubud and prearrange a pickup time, or just give them a call later. This is a great service and so much better than the usual 'shuttle bus' some places offer. The drivers are professional, careful and friendly.

Overall we loved Sandat Glamping Tents, we wished there were more reasons for us to congregate in the communal area with other guests, but this really is all about being with nature and chilling out to the max.

The staff we can't thank enough for making our honeymoons memorable one, they really do care and will go out of their way to help you.

Upon leaving the staff provided us with a gift, a wooden carving for our honeymoon which was a really nice touch.

If you don't mind nature and want peace and tranquility - choose Sandat, you'll love it. We did!
title: Wow. An experience like no other!

text:

text:
So I thought about it long and hard. What kind of review would I give Sandat Glamping in Ubud? 

I enjoy luxurious traveling, great hotels, superb views and fantastic restaurants. And then it dawned on me... the standard to hold Sandat Glamping to, is its own name. Sandat Glamping, that's Indonesian for glamorous camping. 

In short, the hotel delivers in camping but fatally fails on glamour. It's quite totally off the mark. 

So what was good? 
- friendly and helpful staff
- absolutely magnificent environment / gorgeous property
- zen atmosphere 

The negatives in short:
- breakfast offering (very small offering and don't come too late or they're sold out of everything)
- access to the hotel (absolutely dreadful)
- private pool (not really clean and ice cold (while I understand that pools should be refreshing in a climate like this one, let's keep it reasonable please)
- quality of the bed (this was really one of the worst points for us during our stay)
- room amenities (granted, this is glamorous camping, so one needs to concede some princess' luxuries, but fresh towels twice a day in this humid climate isn't too much to ask)
- room disposition (I could go on about this one, but let's just put it like this: there's nothing glamorous about going potty 10 feet from your boyfriend with no way to close a door). 

Let's not be silly, we kinda knew what we were getting into obviously. We were however mislead by the "glamorous" proposition. This is camping. Wonderful camping. Beautiful camping. But camping nonetheless. There will never be anything glamorous about it (and I'm obviously not judging!!!!)

And one other point: the hotel boasts its eco-friendly environment and goals... offers Diet Coke, butter in plastic packs, wifi internet... 

In all, while the hotel isn't astronomically expensive (´bout 300usd à night), it still doesn't boast a good value for money proposition. 

I'm not the kind of person who gives a one or two star review for a broken glass or a crooked napkin... that's just silly. When I give a low mark... I really had a bad time.
title: Failed delivery on its promise

text: Decadent, Eco friendly accommodation with a difference- I booked two of their tents which included private pools. My family spent one night. They provide a very flexible shuttle into Ubud, with wonderful drivers. We were picked up in Seminyak and the dropped to our next accommodation in Sanur, all preorganised via the internet- really a must do.
title: Heaven on earth

text: Our first glamping experience and it was amazing! I love how they are eco friendly and surrounded by nature. We loved the private pool and the big tents, they also don't get hot inside as they have the fans and it's really comfortable. Lovely staff, very welcoming :)
title: Amazing experience

text:
I can't recommend Sandat Glamping enough. The atmosphere was relaxing, the hotel was gorgeous, and the service was unparalleled. Absolutely perfect place to stay in Ubud. 

The hotel staff was very accommodating when helping us plan day-trips and transportation, which was an added bonus.
title: Incredible!!!

text:
My boyfriend & I traveled to Bali for my 25th birthday for 10 days! We stayed in multiple locations all over Bali, but for my actual birthday I wanted to make sure I stayed in Ubud. We chose to stay at Sandat, for two nights! From the moment we got there they immediately made us feel welcomed! We stayed in the Ylang Ylang Luxury Suite Tent, and it was more than perfect. When we walked into the Villa, they had spelled out "Happy Birthday" in flowers on the bed! On top of that every single person there knew it was my birthday so whenever I walked by someone new, they all stoped to tell me happy birthday! The room was incredible, and the pool was very refreshing! At Sandat, you truly feel like you're one with nature, it's amazing. We ate in the common area as much as we could, because the food was DELICIOUS, and the staff so friendly. Each morning/night they would set the tables with different and beautiful tables linens! They are very "eco-friendly" and I enjoyed every minute of being there. The location is perfect - just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the streets of ubud, and the shuttle service they provide is excellent! On our last morning we enjoyed hot stone massages by our pool - perfect way to end our stay!  

The ONLY THING I would say needs some improvement, are the beds... they are tolerable, but a memory foam mattress topper would definitely make it more comfortable! 

I would like to give a special thank you to Ms. Putu, who helped with our reservations and was so accommodating! As well as a big thank you to Tengo - he was a pleasure to speak with! Everyone there is so great! You will not regret booking with Sandat. When we come back to Bali, we will for sure be staying at Sandat; it's very magical. 

- Kiela
title: Birthday Vacation

text: Yep! Loved it! The attention to detail is amazing. This is a beautiful getaway for 2 people. You are away from the centre of Ubud however the free shuttle service is so great and accomodating. The breakfast doesn't have any western touches but is quite nice. The mattress however is awful and very rock hard. That is the only issue we had. Would recommend!
title: Secluded retreat

text:
We stayed 5 nights over the Christmas period with our 8 yo boy. A beautiful location amidst the rice fields and jungle. Our tent has a amazing infinity pool facing the jungle. The tent from South Africa was very well designed . If you stay in the suite tents , they are air conditioning but over our stay we never has to turn it on as we much prefer the naturally cool breeze of the jungle and it was never too hot and can even get a little chilly in the early  morning if it rained over the night. There is no TV and the only other  electrical appliances in the tent are the fans and lightings which was perfect for us as we are looking for natural living experience away from the city. We never have any issues with bugs or mosquitoes during our stay , in fact we got more mosquitoes at a luxury villa we stayed after sandat in Sanur. The team at sandat did a good job in keeping the compound clean , although you do get ants , other insects and geko but then this is part of the charm of the camping experience albeit a glamorous one. So if you are looking for a urban 5 stars hotel experience this is not for you.

All the staffs are friendly and helpful and always ready to do their best to make your stay a happy one.

The breakfast is adequate but could be improved with more choices although I understand it is never easy with a small property of only 8 tents to do a interesting buffet. Perhaps it's better if they could offer by order  ala carte menu breakfast.

Free shuttle to and back from  ubud centre is offered by request, and we never have to wait too long and the drivers are always happy to do their best to drop you off anywhere in ubud when they are not busy.

Overall, I feel this is a property run with heart to do their best for their guests and given the tent settings and location they are doing a good job. I have stayed at other similar accommodation like Soneva Kiri  that are more luxurious but then again it's not fair to compare given the price differential. I would highly recommend sandat if you are looking for a   experience to live close to nature and a peaceful break from urban life. I truly missed the sound and smell  of the jungle sleeping in the tent.

I would rate it 4.5 out of 5.
title: Stylish camping amidst the rice field and tropical jungle.

text: Went to Ubud for our minimoon. And It's our first time staying in a tent! We were surprised that it's actually a real tent! But amazingly, there wasnt any bugs or dust inside the room. And the room also had cool temperature due to natural wind. The view is amazing :) and The breakfast was also good!! And the lunch too, i had pasta there :) the service was also great! And they also provide shuttle bus to the downtown :)
title: Love it to the bits!

text:
We were there on our honeymoon, i loved the pool and how quite it can be. The only downfall was that everything can be heard. The resort consists of 5 tents and 3 tree houses/ huts. We could hear the breakfast buffet being prepared, our neighbors talking so we couldn't enjoy our time together as much as we would have liked because everything and everyone is so close to each other. I like my private life kept private, not for everyone to hear just because "ill never see them again or don't know them". I did like that they offer a complimentary shuttle service into town, you should order it at least 30 min before. As for the tents they are nice and cozy but our tent was full of ants for some reason, and when we showered the drain was semi clogged so just after 2 minutes the water would over flow and get all over.
The fans would make the room cool enough at night but during the day we preferred staying in the pool or going into town, AC's are optional for an extra charge.
The pool was beautiful overlooking the trees and listening to the nearby birds and nature which was nice and relaxing. The breakfast was nice and simple. I loved the freshly made jams and juices and the staff was always kind, helpful and had a smile on their faces. We didn't take a yoga lesson but i would recommend it or even if you know yoga to try out the yoga deck by the reception cause its beautiful all in its own. 
I would recommend that they invest in either training or obtaining an actual bar tender as the staff isn't equipped to make cocktails. Overall, it was a good experience, it just needs a few tweaks here and there.
title: Really liked it but needs a little improvement

text:
After spending five days at boutique resorts around Ubud, we decided to "rough it" a bit at Sandat Glamping Tents. We are so glad we did! The entire experience was one of the most enjoyable and unique stays of our trip. We stayed in one of the tents, which was beautifully constructed in both concept and execution. The tents are solidly built, and a lot of thought clearly went into all of the furnishing and design touches. The private pool overlooking the jungle makes you feel like you're swimming in the wilderness. The experience of spending the night separated from nature by only screens and canvas was a delightful change from staying in big hotels. But for those who prefer a bit more of a buffer from nature, they give you the option to seal off the screen sections at night, and even have air conditioning if it gets too hot.

All of the staff were professional and very responsive. The amenities were far more than we expected from a glamping experience, with room service available in our tents, massage services (my wife claims it was the best massage she has ever had), and a restaurant serving lunch, dinner and a buffet breakfast. We wish we had stayed for longer, and definitely will the next time we're in Ubud.

The only drawback I would mention is the location, which is well off the beaten path. Though it is still close to Ubud center, the roads to get there are narrow (even by Bali standards) and in terrible condition, such that cars have to crawl for most of the last section and back up if they meet any oncoming traffic. They do offer a free on-demand shuttle service, which is good because our cab driver had some trouble finding the place. We were content to spend most of our time luxuriating in our tent and our private pool, but if you plan on going into town frequently the drive could become a hassle.
title: A unique experience!

text:
Where to start? I was a bit uncertain about the 'glamping' concept. But upon arrival I was instantly won over. My fiance and I were blown away by the design, comfort, beauty and cleanliness of the 'tent' we stayed in (the word scarcely does it justice). 

We stayed in the 'Ylang-Ylang' suite. Our own plunge pool, isolated from the world and facing deep into the jungle was perfect for quick dips to cool down from sunbathing, reading and generally relaxing. The wonderful staff even added rose petals in the evening of our last night, which was very romantic and an incredible touch. The circular bed was supremely comfortable and a great size (surprisingly - I'm 6'3). Every detail of the room was beautiful and perfectly presented.

The area is a short drive from Ubud. The free shuttle service into and out of Ubud worked seamlessly, and the drivers were very happy, friendly and great to talk to. 

The breakfast was amazing. There were hot savoury Indonesian options, freshly brewed Kopi Bali (Balinese coffee), fresh pastries and muffins, incredible spreads (like local mango honey and coffee honey), and more. Breakfast is available from 7.30 - 11.30 - which suited us perfectly for our lazy, relaxing stay. 

Other reviews have mentioned insects and wildlife, so I will add that we didn't have any issues whatsoever. You should of course apply sunscreen and bug spray liberally whenever you go outside in Bali, and then you'll be fine. 

Lastly the staff here were just incredible. From Buda, our shuttle driver, to Wayan the yoga instructor who gave us our own personal lesson in the most incredible setting amongst the rice fields, to the amazing receptionist who after we complimented her on her local jewellery offered for us to take it(!!), to Tengo, the lovely manager who drove us all the way to the airport on our last day when the resort was short-staffed due to a religious festival. Please extend our personal thanks to everyone! 

This review might sound over the top, but I really am wondering how I will find another resort, ever, that will match Sandat. We absolutely adored the comfort, ambiance and the incredibly friendly staff. We will definitely go back and would recommend it to anyone.
title: The best accommodation I have ever experienced, bar none

text:
We loved our stay here! This unique hotel is nestled amongst the rice paddies. You feel incredibly relaxed as soon as you arrive here. We got up to do yoga each morning with a local yoga teacher, in the most beautiful setting imaginable - would thoroughly recommend a daily class. He was able to accommodate for all levels of yoga experience brilliantly. We also had a massage on arrival, which was well worth it. 
We stayed in the rice barns which were beautiful. We could not fault them. The private tents are slightly more 'glampy', and have private infinity pools overlooking the jungle, which are pretty special. 
The restaurant has a lot on offer, and the cocktails are delicious. The staff are all very friendly. 
Overall an excellent two nights here, and we left wishing we could stay for longer. Thoroughly recommend booking!

We have glamped in other parts of the world and this definitely had the edge on luxury, and the least bugs!! The site is nestled unobtrusively among rice fields and feels very blended wth the local area. text:
I can't say enough for Pak Tengo, Pak Made and the team at Sandat Glamping. They went out of their way to make our stay the most memorable ever. 

We were here during the month of Ramadan and were observing the Muslim fast, and needed to have our breakfast before sunrise each morning, at 4am, each day of our stay. The chef and wait staff stayed overnight everyday just to be able to prepare our meals for us, which was really very kind of them. 

They would go out of their way to organise anything at any time, for their guests - we had a massage for all 4 of us set up in the comfort of our rooms, with portable air conditioning upon request as well.

I love the views of the vast paddy fields around Sandat, and waking up to the crowing of a cockerel, which just takes you to such a happy peaceful place, far from the madness of Monkey Forest Road and all the other more "touristy" parts of Ubud. 

Emanuela and Federico have done a super job setting up this "Glamp" so tastefully, from the unique bamboo structures and the trendy decor throughout the resort (I especially LOVE the ultra  long table and wall of mirrors at the restaurant), and they have assembled a team of front office, housekeeping and kitchen staff well worthy of winning many, many more awards. 
If you've never experienced glamping, you should give it a go here, at least once in your lifetime. It's well worth the trek.
title: Best service - they go the distance every time!

text: Sandat Glamping delivers glamorous camping to its name. Expect to connect with nature during your stay- plenty of greenery and sounds of the morning cockerel. We had a private pool and enjoyed the privacy that the room offers. I love the uniqueness of Sandat Glamping's service- the staff will ring a bell to inform you before entering your premise and if you do need something, you ring a different 'bell'. Warm and helpful staff to ensure that you are comfortable in your stay (there's a shuttle to ferry you to the centre and their service is prompt!) The padi fields right outside welcome you to observe the local people at work, ducks waddling around and to enjoy the fresh air.We also had the opportunity to be acquainted with the friendly owner. The place is just beautiful.

Special mention also goes out to the drivers Buda Yaso and the older one with a moustache (sorry I didn't get your name). The resort owner Frederick was also attentive and friendly, yet gave us our personal space. 

Truly a recommended place to stay if you are looking for a special holiday.

text:
Hidden amongst the rainforest this retreat provides a unique experience taking the idea of Glamping to the next level. We stayed in Ogah Ogah tent which was impeccably decorated and every detail thought of. The accommodation was very clean, grounds and pools were very well kept. 

The experience was very unique, each morning we would wake up to the sound of nature and due to the privacy and limited number of guests we could truly relax. 

The staff were very friendly and provided the highest level of service. I have travelled around the world and the service was first class, the best I have experienced yet. There was a free shuttle provided into Ubud centre which was about 10 minutes away. 

Things to note: No TV (which we enjoyed) and wi-fi a bit touch and go in the rooms, there is a trick to running the shower, a few bugs here and there but given the somewhat remote location this is to be expected and did not bother us. The tents are fully mosquito proof. 

Breakfast included an array of fruit, museli, yoghurt, toast, eggs made to order, pastries and homemade jams. All the food was very fresh. 

The only thing I could fault is the beds were quite hard.

I would recommend Sandat to anyone looking for a truly unique and once in a lifetime experience!
title: Unique experience nestled amongst the rice paddies and Ubud rainforest

text:
Definitely a boutique hotel here! It's tucked away in the fields of Ubud, and quite a distance form town. But fret not, because transport is available to and from town. The great thing is that the transport is not limited by a certain time, rather you simply has to inform the front office what time you want to head to town and back. I never informed the front office when I felt like going to town, but never waited more than half hour for the car to arrive. If you arranged for your own transfers to the hotel, your driver may not know where the hotel is located as it's quite secluded.Then again, that is the magic of this place. Just have your driver call the hotel to ask for directions. 

I stayed in a 2-story rice barn; the lower floors being the bathroom and living space (open air, non-air conditioned) and the second floor being the bed room (air-conditioned, but can still get really warm in the day). The pool is a shared on among 2 other rice barns. You certainly will feel very safe there and there were occasions that I did not bother locking the bed room door. Perhaps because Sandat isn't a large hotel to begin with and you see pretty much the same faces every day for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The bedroom is very nicely furnished - furnitures and accessories are eclectic and makes me wonder where they bought them. Bathroom is rather unique because it's an outdoor bath and makes peaking at someone showering from the second floor very easy. Because of this, I'd say the rice barn is great for couples or someone you're very comfortable with. 

Breakfast is inclusive and is a fairly simple one with breads, fresh fruits, yoghurt and eggs, but more than enough for me. I must say though,that they have the most interesting assortment of jams and spreads available. Lunch and dinner menu is also pretty decent. The hotel owners are Italian, hence you get Italian food on the menu as well. 

The staff are very friendly and kind. They also turndown the room for the evening. Getting room service can be a little tricky as there is no telephones in the room, rather you have to ring a handbell found on your balcony. But there really is no need for room service. I got quite a bit of insects in my room, most small black ants even on the bed when I haven't eaten anything close to the bed. It's mostly annoying so it'll be great if the hotel could provide ultrasound pest repellers in the room. The place is not entirely devoid of technology - wifi is provided.

If you're looking for a peaceful getaway, Sandat Glamping Tents is an ideal option
title: Gorgeous place!

text:
We stayed for one night only as we had a limited time in Bali. Overall the glamping experience was really neat. The structure where you eat meals is incredible and then tent itself was very nicely done (be prepared to be a little hot though! no AC at all). We were close to the dining area and could see people passing by occasionally through the screen in our bathroom. Not a huge deal but just keep in mind you're not 100% secluded. The private plunge pool was great-wish it was heated though as it was too cold to enjoy much when we were there (February). Regardless we loved spending time outside by the pool in the middle of the jungle.
     The massage we received here was probably the best of our whole trip-and we had it outside listening to the distant jungle noises which was unparalleled. The food was really good, including the breakfast. We found the service to be outstanding. 
     Only con would be that it's overpriced. We paid less to stay at a 5 star resort in a room that was just as secluded and were  overcharged when we took a Sandat car to our next destination that was 10-15 minutes away but still in Ubud. No one mentioned a free shuttle to us. Overall we enjoyed glamping though wouldn't do it again unless they lowered the price.
title: Unique

text: During the New Year break my boyfriend and I stayed at Sandat Glamping Tents for 2 nights. We currently live in Singapore and although it wasn't our first trip to Bali it was our first visit to Ubud. On arrival we were instantly blown away by what Sandat had to offer. The architecture is just incredible! We stayed in Lumbung Legong and I can honestly say it was the best hotel room I have ever stayed in. There was so much attention to detail and the place was spotlessly clean. Not only is the bedroom spacious and comfortable but you also get a large area downstairs to lounge around in or escape the sun in the afternoons. It is also very private. The bathroom is outside which makes for a wonderful and unique experience. Breakfast was fantastic (and I am very picky!) and we enjoyed a wonderful massage one afternoon by our room. The best thing about the whole experience is that you really feel like you are in paradise. The staff don't disturb you or fuss over you yet they cater for all your needs. It's a small resort therefore you feel extremely well looked after. We were fortunate enough to meet the lovely owners too when we were there. There is such a friendly and calm atmosphere about the place. The staff kindly offer a taxi service to the town and other day trips which made planning incredibly stress free. We have already recommended Sandat to all our friends and rebooked for a short break in February before we even checked out! I couldn't speak more highly of this resort. A truly incredible and unique experience. I can't wait to go back in a few weeks!
title: Incredible experience

text: I recently returned from a 10 day trip to Ubud. My son and I stayed at the Sandat Glamping Tents'. We spent most of our stay in a converted rice barn.It was so beautifully desgined with sleeping quarter at the top and an open deck (with comfy sofa's and chairs) and bathroom facilities underneath. Immediately in front was a swimming pool that felt like it was just for us most of the time. I really can't speak highly enough of this wonderful place. I loved the freedom of having the choice to either rest and spend time by the pool or to go off for the day and see the sights- and again nothing disappointed in this area either, Bali is full of breathtaking architecture, making the even the poorest of homes look special to look at and there is plenty to do if you want to. At the 'glamping site' little touches spoke volumes for the kindness of the owners, such as making sure Santa left a present for the guests under the large central xmas tree. My son was delighted Santa knew he was in Bali for Xmas and had left him a gift. We were also indulged in a nights camping in one of the luxury tents- what a great night and the view was spectacular!- I felt as though I was waking up on the edge of the rainforest. Our quarters were cleaned every day, afternoon tea was included and also a complimentary massage to get you in the holiday mood! Most importantly, the whole site felt extremely private and offered you time away from the hustle and bustle of the busy world to restore your body and mind. A big thank you to Emmanuella and all the team for my making my holiday one to remember. I can't wait till I can visit again.

text:
Ubud and its surroundings are full of Swanky five star hotels and retreats but if you want to experience something truly magical head to Sandat, you won't regret it!
Set amid the rice fields this quixotic resort that defies definitions is truly stunning: you'll be able to choose among some luxury tents (more on this later) or three of the lumbungs, traditional Balinese rice barns that have been conceived as spacious apartments. We stayed in one of the tents, actually a lovely structure built with high tech materials that will just about separate you from the adjacent rice field and the forest in front of you. I always hated camping and this is nothing like that: you'll find yourself in a five star room with all amenities and comforts (wooden floors, stylish furniture, comfy bed), don't be put off if, like me, camping is not for you! Every tent has its own private plunge pool and sun chairs. At all time you are far away from indiscreet eyes and the staff will always announce their presence before coming anywhere near your place. Mind that this is also an eco resort and they made the conscious decision not to have aircon (yet the tent was very fresh) or television (but wifi and plenty of books and magazines are available).
Longest review I've ever posted on tripadvisor, yet it's not over.
Enjoy the "living", as they call it: a huge bamboo structure that will impress even the most jaded of architects where you can enjoy your dinners (we had sone lovely Italian) or your sumptuous breakfast (best bread we've found in Bali and a lot of choice).
Enjoy the tropical garden and be amazed to find out that all the lush plants are just two years old.
What else can I say? If you don't mind spending the extra dollar and you are looking for a true memory then Sandat is the ideal place for you!
title: A truly magical place

text: Sandat is a hidden retreat on the outskirts of Ubud. The design is something very special, tents and lumbungs nestled in hidden away paddy fields and forests. The attention to detail on design is exceptional and the service is superb. We had a few problems with air conditioning but all was forgiven with how much effort the team went to to resolving the issues and making us comfortable. Truly magical and a must visit.
title: Blissful retreat

text:
We've stayed in Ubud on a number of occasions but wanted to try something different and thought this looked perfect. We had a lovely time but there were a few things that could have been better:

Pros:
- The rooms were beautiful and very well maintained. The pool was great too although it could have been a little cleaner. There was a film of sunscreen on the top when we arrived and lots of dirt and other bits floating around (not plant material!)
- The food was good although a little expensive and there was a reasonable amount of choice at breakfast
- The massage we had was really good
- Great surroundings - beautiful rice fields and lovely sounds at night from all the wildlife
- Lovely oil candles were lit at night around the room and grounds which was beautiful

Cons:
- Bear in mind that you are literally meters away from other tents. The only thing between the rooms are screens of plants so you can see into other people's pools. They provide you with an iPod speaker so you can also hear other people's music very clearly as the rooms are made of canvas. Slightly annoying and did ruin the atmosphere a bit
- Some of the staff were less than helpful at times. The manager said he would look into whether we could have a late check out but never got back to us during our stay, which was frustrating. We were also made to feel that we were causing problems - when we asked to get the shuttle bus into town for example, we were met with an abrupt 'well you've missed it' and told it wouldn't be around for at least an hour and that was that. It then turned up 5 minutes later... The shuttle bus driver on the hand was absolutely wonderful as were the waitresses in the restaurant. We've always had great service in Bali (have been going for the last 10 years) and were surprised that some of the staff were so short with us
- There is no safe in the room which was quite a bit issue for us as we travel with ipads, passports, money etc and were conscious that the rooms were easily accessible. There is a communal safe in reception but a couple of times it was full when we went to leave our stuff so we couldn't use it
title: Lovely stay in Ubud

text: Stayed for 2 nights in Penjor suite tent. Everything was impeccable, like it should be for this price. Tents are very elegant but also comfortable and they come with the private infinity pool. They are perfect for romantic holiday.
title: Luxury amidst the rice fields

text:
Would highly recommend to experience Sandat Glamping. 
It's a peaceful piece of paradise surrounded by rice fields, we immediately felt in love as soon as we were taken in our tent, the Banten one. From the shabby chic decor to the private pool everything made us breathe luxury and love of the owners for the care of their customers. 
Waking up in the morning with the sounds of the nature is priceless and makes it the perfect romantic retreat. 
Breakfast served 'till late in the morning with homemade bakeries, fresh fruits was really good. 
We had dinner in the restaurant several times and the food was amazing. 
It has to be said that the owner Federico and manager Alberto being Italian really managed to teach local staff to provide an impeccable and discreet service. 
Early morning yoga classes would make the place even more perfect for a peaceful retreat, but when I suggested that I've been told they are working in it and it will be done very soon.
title: Peaceful and romantic retreat

text:
By far the most beautiful place we stayed during out travels: worthy of a place in an interior design magazine.
We stayed in one of the Lumbung with an open ground-level sitting room facing the pool (the lumbungs share a larger pool - though we never saw another soul).  The bathroom was vast, the living area was vast, the bedroom was vast...
The design is awesome and I think I took photos of every tiny detail.  
The main dining area is gorgeous - with books and games, and lots of space for socialising or privacy as you see fit.
The food was good.  Breakfast especially was extensive and varied.
So why have I rated as 4 and not 5?  This was a hard decision.  Definitely the best place we stayed in Indonesia (some of which have scored 5).  But this was also by far the most expensive place we stayed in Indonesia and so my expectations are higher.  Some tiny niggles: a small wine list with several wines unavailable; they ran out of tea; the dinners were 'tourist-ified' - Indonesian dishes were dampened down to suit western tastes; smoking at the communal dinner table was unappreciated.
title: Wow!

text:
We have stay at Sandat Galmping Tents three times since they opened and have never been disappointed. Roberto & Federico have done such an amazing job in creating a peaceful paradise in the hills of Ubud.
From the service to the serenity, we would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a unique and tasteful experience.
Next time we will stay for much longer. Sorry it took so long for us to review!
title: Beautiful Establishment

text: I heard about the Glamping from a friend of mine and I decide to spend a couple of day there during my trip in Bali.
