text:
a very friendly driver picked us up in ubud to get to our new home for the next night. as i saw, were my boyfriend brouhgt me without telling, i was nearly out of control. we ended up in a very beautiful and big tent, with flowers on the bed, very tasteful furniture and a huge bathroom. on our terrace were two sunbeds, that were so comfortable, that i did not move for the whole day. why should i, we had our own swimmingpool in the middle of the woods. the staff was so friendly, they even put a lot of candles on the road to the tent, so we could also find our way at night. the breakfast at the next day was in a beautiful surrounding with tea/coffe, bread, different marmelades, eggs, fruit, yoghurt and müsli.... mhhhh!!!!
in this place every detail was perfect- we would love to come back one day!! everything was as described on the internet and the pictures tell the truth ;-)
as we had to leave i definiftly was sad, but there was this beautiful ring on my finger since last night, so nothing could really take me down...
title: our stay was just amazing!!!

text:
We stayed at the Sandat Glamping tents in Bali, Ubud ( Lumbung legong and kecak) from 16-19th July 2015. Its a beautiful, peaceful and secluded property with literally nothing else around it but rice fields. I will do a quick pros and cons review to give a fair and balanced view of my experience. 

Pros:
- ideal for honeymooning couples for the privacy it offers
- The staff are great, personable, accommodating and friendly
- The property itself is extremely unique, original and beautifully done up
- Breakfast is limited but enough
- They have a free car pick and drop service to and fro to the Ubud market which is very convenient and a must

Cons:
- its a very small property, so you cant do much on it - like taking walks or sitting at different cafe's etc
- the Lumbung Tents are two levels so each time you want to use the bathroom, you need to climb down a flight of 10 rather steep steps with no hand railing for support
- they say they have room service but you dont have any device in the room to call the staff so you pretty much keep going to their kitchen and back when you need anything. it feels like they should be paying you for room service
- the bath water is moody and you may have to wait  up to 10 minutes before getting warm water
-For families with kids and people traveling with their parents, its not ideal in terms of accessibility (steep stairs to the  room) and no steps to climb up to the living space on the ground floor, you literally have to jump (Applies only to Lumbung tents)
- The photographs make the place look HUGE but actually the room sizes are half of what you see online in the pictures which is disappointing 

So all in all, definitely not worth the money of a five / four star property but the original concept, staff and Ubud weather in July made up for it.
title: Not worth the money

text: I stayed at Sandat Glamping with my 3 teenager kids. The experience of living in lumbung (barn) in the middle of rice field was something unique and fun. I personally like the touch of modern facilities ( like hot water, clean bed and air con) and natural surrounding and nocturnal music at night. Highly recommended for those who are looking for tranquility and yet can't give the modern necessity.
title: Tranquil and exquisite experience

text: These glamping tents are an absolute dream! My boyfriend and I stayed here while we were in Ubud and we didn't even leave the resort it was that amazing! We stayed in a tent that had our own private pool and when we first arrived we were welcomed with fresh mango juice and showed around our place. You feel as if you are in the middle of nowhere and each "tent" is very spacious and private. The modern amenities are dream worthy and the way everything is decorated beautifully brings everything together. Since it is technically a tent you are completely immersed in the beautiful surrounding nature and it feels as if you are outside. Breakfast is included with everything you can think of and the restaurant at the resort has amazing food with very reasonable prices. I cannot rave more about this place and would recommend it over anywhere in Bali. It is a completely different experience from a normal resort and you need to do this at least once in your lifetime.
title: Best Stay Ever!

photos.caption: A huge mirror wall in the dining area!

text:
Sandat is a unique experience of extreme luxury and uncompromised Ubud. This hotel not only gives you the beautiful amenities and hospitality you need to feel on vacation, but it also offers a feeling of totally escaping from the world. 

The resort land is outside of Ubud city area and it is situated in between the balinese jungle and authentic rice paddies. The staff are incredibly kind and welcoming and the food is outstanding. I spent two nights here in both their Lumbung and their Suite. Each offering world class experiences.

If you plan to visit Ubud and want to experience an authentic getaway, you must visit Sandat. I hope to be back one day.
title: The Best Getaway in all of Bali.

text:
Stayed in June as a couple in white tent for 5 nights, great decor, surrounded by lush gardens, a private deck & plunge pool. Small fridge/ minibar, tea coffee Wifi, no tv. Bathroom is at back of tent separated from the sleeping area by a small screen. You fall asleep to the chorus of the local wildlife croaking & chirping, if you are a light sleeper you might need earplugs.
We ate at the restaurant every day. Breakfast was substantial, bread, pastries, cake, bacon & eggs cooked how you like. Dinner not a huge variety but good quality ingredients, if you want special Balinese dinner you order in advance. 
Free shuttle bus to Ubud & back when required, Kanagi is an excellent driver very friendly, helpful & informative. All the staff were very friendly & helpful. Sandat will arrange excursions & activities - we did the cooking class and enjoyed that.
Location-surrounded by rice paddy fields, go for walks along the road, be sure to stop at the small warung you can buy snacks etc there & meet the local people.
I liked the green philosophy, bath toiletries are in containers which are refilled so you are not throwing away lots of plastic. Bali has enough plastic to deal with! The buildings & tents blend beautifully into the landscape. Overall a very relaxing place, good food, loved the tent & plunge pool but do take into account this is an agricultural community with the associated noise (machinery) and smells (fires)
title: Relax relax relax

text: I Can't say enough good things about this place. My wife and I spent Two nights in one of the glamping tents and we absolutely loved it. The drive to the resort is beautiful. Its surrounded by picturesque rice paddies and tall palms. Once you step into the resort it's like stepping into a little eden. The whole resort is beautiful landscaped and decorated. The room/tent was very clean, roomy, and comfortable. This was our first experience glaming and it was so much more luxurious than I had expected. The tent was supplied with everything you could need, electricity, two fans, beautiful bathroom with some basic toiletries and harrying (a plus for my wife and something she often misses with tradition camping) and were just beautiful inside. The private pool, wood floors, and room decor was all very nice, well thought out, and the area provided a lot of privacy. FOOD! I love experiencing new food when we travel and the restaurant here is without question the BEST I have been to in all of Bali! No Joke. They served very tasty appetizer/finger-food dishes before the meals. Make sure to try any of the Italian dishes. The grilled tuna and spare ribs special I tried were also very good. Breakfast is also very nice here. Everything was cooked to perfection (not exaggerating here) and had tons of great flavor! I would make the drive just to eat here. Ok food rant is done. I like my food if you can't tell ;) Over all this was a relaxing and fun new experience for luxury accommodation for us. The staff were super friendly and the owners were very welcoming and helpful as well. For sure give this place a try!
title: A Unique Experience You Won't Want To Miss!

text: What an amazing place; outside Ubud, away from all the traffic hustle in Ubud town which is actually worse than Kuta or Legian. Right in the rice fields, no street noise, secluded small hotel with individual tents and Lumbungs. EXCELLENT Staff every where, high quality linen, towels etc. Restaurant is good, just don t expect a huge menu or daily changing buffets. Breakfast is sumptuous but the jams are of an exotic flavour, might not be anyones taste (but there s a lot of them to choose from). Enjoyed every single minute, staff also extremly helpfull in organizing tours, walks etc. We had a cooking lessons arragend by them and it was a a wonderfull and itneresting experience. They also offer drop off s and pick ups to / from Ubud so if you feel the need to go there jsust ask on e of the staff at the reception. The feeling while lying in your private pool is amazing .... nothing but nature around you! AAA rating!
title: Heaven

text:
It's incredibly difficult to put into words how beautiful this place is. A stylish and breathtakingly amazing set up so wonderful that you'd have to be made of stone not to appreciate it.

 Nestled in amongst the rice paddy fields you are never far from the rich culture of Ubuds farm lands and it's wonderfully hospitable  people.

The staff are extremely professional, attentive and make you feel like family rather than guests. 

Our suite was a little oasis of calm which felt like you were cocooned in pure luxury.

Excellent food, amazing grounds and if you come off season like we did you'll feel like you have the whole place to yourselves. 

Book this immediately as I'm sure it won't be long before it has a waiting list into oblivion! 

Xxx
title: The best place you will ever stay!

text: Me and my boyfriend both agree that this is the best place we have ever stayed when vacationing. We will return here 100%!! Staff are so lovely and helpful. Food is AMAZING!! The whole resort is breath taking. We stayed in the Ogoh Ogoh tent which is the orange themed tent.... So beautiful. The attention to detail in the interior design of the whole place is simply beautiful. The sound of the forrest is soothing and helped me relax, i was worried about insects but not once did i panic over a visitor in the tent :) shuttle service was available as soon as we wanted it and our driver was a pleasure to meet! I could rave on forever.... If you want something different to a hotel and don't mind taking the shuttle in to Ubud centre which is 10-15 minutes away, then stay here. In fact, don't stay anywhere but here if you are in Ubud xxx
title: Amazing!!

text:
My wife and I stayed here last month after a few days in Jakarta for work.  What a relief it was to get to Ubud, and an even bigger relief to be at Sandat Glamping.  We stayed in the orange glamping tent which came with its own pool.  We looked out into the bush which started as our deck ended.  There was even a decent sized Durian growing on a tree just out of reach. (Nice taste, horrendous smell).

We really enjoyed our stay here.  It is a very laid back facility with really pleasant staff who were more than willing to help.  There is an easy to arrange transfer people mover that takes you into Ubud and brings you back when required.  It does finish not long after 10pm, so if you are wanting a big night a taxi may be required.  There may be a bit of a challenge with this though as most of the taxis did not seem to know where the accomodations were.  Also be aware that the road up is currently very rough, so have your wits about you if you are riding a bike or motorbike.

The accomodations was all we wanted and then some.  Comfy bed, fan for the daytime heat and a rug for the night time cold, which was required when we were there.  Breakfast was included with really nice locally made French style compotes.  Service was a bit hit and miss at breakfast, and with evening drinks but always with a smile and we were never in a rush so no major worries there.  The staff appeared genuinely nice, no fake smiles at all.

Ubud itself was pretty good.  We enjoyed it a lot more than down on the coast.  Great place to wander around with stacks of local attractions from a laid back spas to riding mountain bikes offroad down off a nearby volcano.

Would I stay at Sandat Glamping again?  Without a doubt, yes
title: Excellent break amongst the padi above Ubud

text:
Wow. Absolutely the most incredible, beautiful and serene resort we have ever stayed and visited. Located about 15 minutes from the centre of Ubud, attentive and lovely staff, delicious breakfasts and private surrounds.

Loved every minute!!! Will be back for sure.
title: Paradise on Earth

text:
My last stay in Upud was 20 years ago, and a lot has changed ever since. There is not much left from the former village that housed many artists. Now the city is crowded with people, and heavy traffic is everywhere. 
So it´s not for the city itself, but for the fantastic accomodation, that I would go back there anytime. The italian owners, Emanuelle and her husband, have created an oasis of peace and tranquillity. This luxurious resort is far away from beeing posh, which I personally found very pleasant. There I enjoyed 5 great days, relaxing in my tent and at the private pool, surrounded by gorgeous nature. The staff of the „Sandat“ cared for me anytime. I also enjoyed the free shuttle bus to the city exactly the time I asked for. Do you have your stay in „Sandat“ still bevor you? You are very ucky indeed!!!
title: Oasis of peace

text:
Absolutely stunning hotel! Beautiful grounds and facilities, lovingly designed by the owner with some very clever design features that reflected the surroundings. Extremely romantic and felt very exclusive as there aren't loads of rooms. Our tent (Ylang-Ylandg was beautiful, and our splash pool and decking area gorgeous.

Food was lovely, especially the breakfast, and service was very good. There were also some lovely touches, including a honeymoon display on our bed when we arrived, and a lovely departing gift of a wooden carved mask. 

My husband also got ill one day and the owner and staff were so lovely and helpful - really went the extra mile trying to help make him feel better. 

This was our favourite stay of the honeymoon, would love to go back and can't recommend highly enough!
title: Incredible honeymoon stay

text: We stayed in the suite tents in early may as a couple. We loved the experience and wished w had a few days longer. The entire hotel development is beyond beautiful in location as well as decor. The tents themselves are luxurious and spacious and super private. The owners who happened to be there during our stay were most welcoming and enchantingly friendly. The staff is friendly and discreet, the services they provide are extremely well organised and of amazingly high to western standards quality. we had a couple of times massage outside "au natural" and that was amazing. The entire experience was just wonderful and just faultless. Highly recommend.
title: A taste of paradise

text: Stayed here 3 nights last week in the Lumbung Legong. It was the perfect choice. I'd think it's one of the few in Ubud that actually exceeds the photographs. Service was incredible (on hand when required, whilst you're offered a lot of space to relax peacefully). The Lumbung's are very comfortable, really cool downstairs chill out bit , and decorative bedroom above. Outside bathroom was nice touch too. Food was very good and fairly priced.  Gardens are exquisitely manicured. Saw the tents too and they seemed great if you just wanted to lock yourself away with private pool overlooking river below. We met the owner who was charming and has obviously invested a lot in furnishing the place.  credit to staff running it though - all was excellent.
title: Beautifully designed - high quality furnishings, v best service

text: I spent 2 nights in the Ogah Ogah tent with my partner and it was absolutely magical, from the moment we arrived we felt completely relaxed and pampered.  The staff are friendly and professional, the area is peaceful and remote although is only a 10 minute drive to Ubud shops and restaurants, the design and fit out of the tents is incredibly glamorous and the restaurant  and surrounds are divine.  We spent most of our time in Ubud at Sandat, ate several times in the restaurant and had relaxing balinese massage in our tent.  We can't wait to go back and chill by the plunge pool listening to the sounds of nature.  I highly recommend Sandat Glamping to couples looking for a romantic and unique getaway.
title: Magical experience!

text: Stayed one night in the tent which was awesome fun then decided to book a night in a Lumbung and loved it so much we booked another night. They are really cool sitting underneath with an open lounge room feel. The food at the restaurant was awesome so we ate here every night. Breakfast was delicious. Take a stroll through the rice padi's and make sure you stop at the shop for a drink or chat the family is so nice. The beds are more like futon firmness.
title: Peaceful retreat

text: A highlight of our trip also, if you are looking for quiet seclusion in the middle of Bali you are looking in the right place. The tents are awesome and I would recommend to everyone to try this out once in their lives. Walking down the bush lined trails to the private tents makes you feel like you have left everything behind and can totally relax. The rooms are well decorated, amenities are good and the pool is amazing. The staff are outstanding and are more than happy to accommodate any request while respecting your privacy. The only suggestion for improvement would be to have a menu for the breakfast time and possibly an ice machine quests can access. Otherwise 5 out of 5 and I cannot wait to return and bring some more friends!
title: Escape the everyday

text: Just left several days ago and would like to go back. A jewel in this crowdy Ubud. In the ricefields we found our own jewel. Thanks to Federico for this beautiful place.We took hundred of pictures but they can not describe the magic of the place. Interior is great, the sound of nature is great, even Wifi works very well. The stuff so nice and heplful-in 3 words ITS A DREAM  .If you want the most exiting and special place in Ubud have a stay in this place  Thanks for being your guests
title: my Bali dream came true

text:
This was one of the highlights of my trip! The hotel area is beautiful and well maintained between jungle and rice fields. We stayed in a tent where you could really feel (and hear!) the nature around you. And I mean you are in the middle of nature. In a tent. That means the jungle around you is noisy at night, so if you are a light sleeper, bring your ear plugs ;) I enjoyed the fact there's no tv (goos wifi though). The tent was amazing, you wouldn't expect to find such luxury in a tent! And everything was spotless clean - I can't imagine how they keep the place free of mold? If you are fussy about your toilet privacy I remind you this is a tent - so there's only a curtain separating the bathroom from the living area ;)

The staff were very friendly and helpful. There's a free shuttle service to Ubud (takes about ten minutes) if you want to see around. The only minus was the breakfast which was very small; bread, cakes, yoghurt, cereal, fruits - I was expecting to get more considering the price. I would definitely recommend to stay here!
title: Unique experience!

text: Wow! What a Good memory. My husband and I do live 5km from the Sandat Glamping but after a stressful time opening a business we really needed to stay few days in a relaxing and peaceful place (Ubud is crowded and we live a lovely house close to the road so we wanted a place far from engine's noise) we have found there the perfect place for our needs! We stayed at the Tent Sarong which is (like the other tents we visited) really well decorated, all the materials chosen are, for us, good quality and absolutely charming. All the details in this tent make you feel peaceful. We were fascinated by all the kinds of trees you can find here. If you like the sound of the nature & insect, the trees, the wood, the bamboo (the restaurant is amazing, an open air massive structure in Bamboo) the calm, you will find the perfect place here. We saw review talking about insects, mosquitoes, yes that's true there's mosquitoes and they bite like everywhere in Bali but here you are in the middle of rice fields and forest, how you can avoid this? Just take you mosquito repellent and enjoy the forest's life! The owners are really nice as the wife was really available by email, she answered really quickly and her husband (we met him there) is really cool. They match with their place. The staff is also really nice and pleasant. Highly recommended!
title: Perfect place in the nature

text: Sandat rescue the silence and the nature of the original Ubud. Beautiful rice fields, amazing gardens around the tents, friendly service, silence, all perfectly decorated and set up. Sleeping in the tents is something unique in Bali. For those looking for tranquility, nature and lonely walks in the real Bali, this is the place to stay. It is out if the noise of Ubud but very near at the same time. The owners are cool people ready to orient and help you. A must in Ubud
title: Genuine Ubud

text: Our stay here was the highlight of our trip to Bali. We stayed in the white tent this past November and were the only guest booked during that time. This may be one of the most gorgeous properties I have ever stayed. The staff was extremely attentive, willing to help and offer advice. I you are looking for a quite escape, this is you place. The property is surrounded my rice patties, there is a short drive up dirt roads to get to the property.
title: Perfection

text:
I booked this trip a few months back as a birthday treat for myself. It was really a blessing that Sandat Glamping is so peaceful since aside from my birthday in Feb, my mom passed away suddenly in Jan. This place provided me with a needed break to put my mind at ease & my heart at peace.

Staying at this resort was really a pleasant experience from start to finish. That said, I'd like to include some things that other guests need to be aware of as well as the hiccup we experienced during our stay.

THE AWESOME:

All my questions & transfer arrangements were efficiently answered via email before my weekend stay. They even let me pick my own Lumbung (I stayed at Lumbung Legong which has the best view of the three Lumbungs). On the arrival day, we had to make last minute changes due to some flight delays. The driver waited for us and the hotel kept calling me to keep me updated on the pick up status & also to check whether I've located the driver.

Getting there is an hour plus from Denpasar and closer to the resort is an unpaved road. So it's rough for a short while but that's ok because on the way, you see the beautiful view of the rice paddies surrounding the resort. Our driver even let us stop in certain places to take photos of the sunset. 

From there, everything was smooth and efficient. Check-in was fast & they wait until check out before they ask you to pay (all food & activities arranged by the resort will just be in your tab first). They can arrange tours for you as well as activities. If you want to rent a car w/ driver the whole day for your own personalized tour, that can be done also. There's a van that can bring you to Ubud center, then you can be picked up from anywhere there. The restaurant in the resort serves European type of breakfast, with an addition of eggs & ham cooked to your liking (tip: the omelette is yummier than the scrambled eggs). It's not a huge buffet spread but the selection is of high quality. Afternoon tea is served as well (can be in the resto or in your room) even if you arrive way past tea time. The resto also serves lunch & dinner, and will provide you with unlimited bottled water upon request. 

When we were there, there were a few other guests but for most of our stay, it was only me & my bf in the entire resort. Needless to say, we felt like VIPs. The staff made sure that we were undisturbed. Yet whenever we stepped out of our Lumbung, they were alert & eager to assist with whatever we needed no matter what time it was. 

Now about our Lumbung, we really couldn't ask for anything more. It was so beautiful, well maintained, clean and very relaxing. We're happy we chose the Lumbung over the Tent because we had the ground floor lounge area which was perfect for chilling out anytime. The hotel towels were of good quality & smelled good while the pillows were fluffy & new. There's a lot of storage in the room for your things as well as a fridge, ipod dock and a table.

THE THINGS WORTH KNOWING PRIOR TO BOOKING:

If you're travelling with friends or colleagues, it can get a bit awkward. In the Lumbungs, the bathrooms are the open concept type. So anyone climbing your stairs no matter how low they are on the staircase can easily see the person in the shower. To see the person on the toilet, all you have to do is lean further. For the Tents, the bathroom is inside the room with only curtains separating the two. So you'll need to travel with people you're really comfortable with.

Personally, we like the Lumbung better than the Tent. It's bigger, has a view, has airconditioning and the winning feature is the first floor lounge area. We were told that in the Tents, you can request for a portable airconditioner (with a fee) if it gets too warm. And yes, it was very warm during morning til afternoon. 

The resort is designed to be peaceful, eco friendly & close to nature. As such, if you're creeped out by insects or the sounds of nature, then please think twice. We, on the other hand, didn't mind and had fun trying to figure out what the sounds were. By the way, if you're worried about mosquitos, the resort provides a mosquito coil in the room. We didn't use ours and didn't have any mosquito bites. 

For entertainment, there's no TV but there's wifi & an ipod dock. For us, we really enjoyed the fact that we got a break from technology (except for our mobile phones) and just focused on relaxing & doing nothing. 

THE HICCUP:

Our only concern was that we had a problem with the hot water the whole weekend. Apparently, it's a problem for the whole resort based on our stay there and another previous review. They tried their best to help us & fix the problem but I think they may need to change the whole heater system to resolve the issue.

THE VERDICT:

I would love to come back and stay in this resort for another super relaxing trip. In terms of recommending it to my friends, I'd recommend it to couples or very very close friends. If the resort can do a minor adjustment to cover the bathroom of the Lumbungs more, then that would open up the type of guests visiting. That is, if the hot shower gets fixed :)
title: peaceful oasis w/ a tiny hiccup

text:
My fiancé booked the 'White' tent as part of my 30th birthday trip to bali and we were both very excited due to the great reviews and the concept of Glamping. On first impression we were both blown away by our beautiful tent and there is nothing to fault about it at all! But a few things along the way has really left us disappointed:
1. My partner emailed ahead to arrange transport from Seminyak where we were staying, to sendat and to also arrange a cake to surprise me with on my birthday (3/2/15), however he never received a response. While we were in Seminyak he called sendat to ask abt the transport, and when he called, he was asked to email them instead. After he explained that he had emailed already without a response and therefore was calling , the person on the other line still insisted him to email. Needless to say, we didn't bother and asked our Seminyak hotel to arrange the transport instead. We also necer got our cake. 
2. We were told that if we needed anything, we should use the xylophone provided (nice concept but unsure how effective), lady said to use it twice just to make sure. We used it to ask for toothpaste, after returning to our tent. We had walked past the girls at the restaurant only 5 mins ago yet no one came. After ringing it repetitively, we finally went out of our tent only to find the girls squatting behind the bar chatting. When we asked for toothbrush, the girl did not understand. When we finally got our toothbrushes, we found they didn't have toothpaste with them like normal hotel ones, however we couldn't be bothered with the whole xylophone thing again.
3. Last night we stayed here the hot water ran out. 2 of the staff came and tried to fix it, but they could not, so they offered for us to use the tent next doors, however when I got next door with all my toiletries I was told that it also was not working! The staff then told us to wait in our tent while they returned to fix the shower, after waiting longer, they informed us it was not fixable and asked whether we wanted to use the lombung one. We were tired by then so declined. The 2 staff really tried but nevertheless the fact that we couldn't use our shower in our tent was very disappointing. 

A highlight of our stay was our lovely driver, who patiently came to pick us up at anytime, and who always took time to chat and explain local culture and scenery to us. 
I found the rest of the staff to be lacking in their attitudes & their English. 
We were the only guests at the time, and instead of feeling really well treated, we were stared at a lot by idle staff members. I felt the staff were not as welcoming as I imagined.
The tents and decor itself is unquestionably beautiful, but I think that to make sendat Glamping competitive against all the other accomodations avail in Ubud, it needs to train its staff better and to have certain protocols in place in case something goes wrong so that guests are comfortable (and don't habe to take cold showers!)
title: Beautiful tents but a few let downs marred an otherwise great stay

owner_response.text:
Dear Wannie, 
 

Thank you for giving us feedback on your stay, it is always important for us and helps us improve. We will go through your points one by one.

 

1)      We truly regret that your email was not replied to, but after thoroughly checking we confirm that we never received a request from you via email. We always pay particular attention to the requests of our guests, especially when there are happy occasions to celebrate in our Glamping. We regret not being able to provide a bouquet of flowers with which Sandat Glamping Tents welcomes its guests on such occasions. We found that even at the time of booking by BOOKING.COM (as is usually the case), there were no requests made and a mention of a birthday was not received. We therefore believe that the email address to which you have submitted your request for the cake and the transfer was incorrect. Regarding the transfer, our receptionist – whom you contacted by telephone – required a confirmation email in order to arrange your transfer from Seminiak: it is our protocol that the request must be made in writing stating the exact address and stating the tariff agreed.

 

2)     We are also sorry to have disappointed you with toothpaste & toothbrushes that were not those you find in a normal hotel. Ours is not and does not want to be a “normal hotel” We are a "glamping" pledged to respect nature and to limit waste production: only biological toothbrushes and toothpaste are provided on request as specified in the brochures that are found in the tents. It is a fact that the majority of hotel toiletries end up in the trash still unused! Our GREENPHILOPOPHY also applies to the decision not to equip our Luxury Tents (albeit richly furnished) with television or phone and we remain convinced that using a musical instrument to call room service (although the sound can sometimes be confused with the sounds of nature!) gives us a break from the habits of the city, making us feel in harmony with the explosive nature of Bali.

 

 

3)     As for our staff, as you reported, it seems that they have done their best in an attempt to remedy the problem of the water heater. Unfortunately, unpredictable problems such as the malfunction of the water heater can only be resolved by a change of the room (this is our normal procedure if there is any inconvenience), and the unlucky situation consisted in two changes, but you declined. No one loves cold showers, we know...

 

In any case we are pleased you were happy with the setting, the decorations and our driver, "was lovely and always available ....... " These words seem to demonstrate that you felt you were treated well by our staff. The relaxed manner of the staff is not to be interpreted as indifference, it is a cultural trait that is one of the reasons we have chosen Bali for a second home. Rhythms are different; we do our best to make our guests comfortable but we will never be a hotel. It is our aim to diffuse the pace and culture of the Bali spirit.

 

We are at your disposition for further clarification and hope that your lasting memories of Bali with your fiancé remain happy ones. Hoping to welcome you again to Sandat, we send you our very

 

Best regards,
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: At first heading to this place was a bit harsh since the road are still not pave and still dirt road, but once you reach this place it is like so wonderful because the structure and how the place was build looked awesome. It is a whole new experience staying in this exclusive tent style rooms with private pool that is overlooking the forest. The tent was very private and very nice, the breakfast was awesome and the staff are excellent..
title: Heavenly Outdoor Style Experience

text: Stayed at Sandat Glamping for the first two days of my trip and regretted immediately for not staying throughout. My partner and I were fortunate to be the only guests at the resort and we loved the privacy. The villas were spacious, and eco friendly. Situated in the middle of a rice field, it takes approximately 5 minutes to get to the Ubud city center with the all day complimentary shuttle on call. What I enjoyed most was the service and the ability to immerse completely in a natural environment which made me feel instantly refreshed and ready to go. Breakfast is served at this gorgeous long table (pls refer to my pics) and being the only two guests it felt as if we booked out the entire hotel for ourselves! Activities can be arranged a day in advance at the guest relations booth. If you're deciding between the villa tents or the rooms by the pool, I'd suggest the villas. More privacy 😊😊😊
title: Luxury Camping in the heart of Ubud

text: Stayed at this place right among paddy fields, off Ubud town for a memorable day and night.The approach is a broken path surrounded by greens all around and suddenly appears ,this resort.It is a small but extremely well maintained and developed property offering a lush garden cum foresty feel all around.The tents offer individual pools and space with complete privacy and offcourse the peace and tranquility.Every tent has been done up very tastefully and elegently.The staff is extremely helpful and polite.The food needs to improve as we could gather from the owner the cooks are mainly balinese.
title: simply fantastic

text:
If you travel a lot you are able to notice a good hotel right away. The glamping tents are good. They have perfect style! It is hard to add something as well as to take away something. Everything in tents is perfect. But what makes Sandat to stand out is the privacy policy. You are the king there. 

The "remote location" is only 15min drive from Ubud. But it gives you rice field view, silent evenings and a possibility to watch the stars. Once you are there you feel foolish to leave before you have to.

What makes this place above the rest is how they take notice on clients remarks. Only detail we did not like was lack of vegetarian food in the menu. They still fixed us vegetarian food and truly were interested how to improve the quality of that. As I know hotel/resort business I have to admit that the managers attitude is the right one. He has been working himself up from the ground and respects his staff. Leading by example is often talked but too seldom followed. Here it is followed. We had nice talk with the manager and owner and I am sure that they will truly do the best they can to make this special please a pure heaven! 

To be truthful, it already is a small paradise. Here you can have a quality holiday if you love to rest, read and relax. It is suitable for looking inwards, being with your loved ones and noticing to sounds of nature as much as it is possible in Bali (you will hear some distant bike noise etc but it is not disturbing). It is not a place for party people and action tv addicts who can not live without action. But that is what makes it special! It enables to be out of ordinary world (even it has good internet, if you need to keep in touch with outside world).

Strengths here are: atmosphere; the way details support the concept; style; privacy; stunning tents with private pools; breakfast; closeness to Ubud; lack of weaknesses!

We absolutely loved it. We recommend it. We would and probably will return here! Keep it special!
title: Perfect atmosphere, lovely tents!

text: What turned out to be everything I expected and more from this resort - fabulous location, exquisite tents and first class customer service was erased in one single moment when, upon checking out I was accused of stealing a small towel from the tent and the supervisor proceeded to check my luggage. I cannot tell you how much this hurt and how humiliating it was as I do not steal hotel property or take anything that does not belong to me FACT ! An apology was offered and an explanation that the staff had clearly not equipped the tent with the correct number of towels the day before. The staff should try to understand how it feels to be accused of stealing and how upset and angry I now am as I head home  - not the feel good factor I was hoping to achieve from my holiday in Bali.
title: What a terrible shame

text: It was a great decision to stay in glamping sandat hotel! We stayed there for three nights and we enjoyed everything: the place, the food, the privacy, the staffs. The building is wonderfully designed (especially the restaurant with bamboo structure), the detail of the hotel is amazing. Every tend is designed differently making even the booking process is unique because you choose one of the tends which suits you the most. We stayed at the brown tend and we were amazed by the toilet which is surrounded by rice field view. In the night, you can hear the sound of the crickets and enjoy a very peaceful night. The access to the hotel is a little bit difficult if you use your own transportation but the hotel provide free shuttle which is always available everytime you wanna go to Ubud's center. The staffs there were always very friendly and helpful. We even got free massage service when we told that we are there for our honeymoon. The hotel also provide many programs for you such as bike tour and cooking class but we chose to arrange our own program. Overall, this hotel is a highly recommended one!

text:
We’ve been in Bali 9 times, and now, Sandat became our favourite hotel !!

If you know Ubud, you know that the nature sounds around the rice fields are unique… and that’s exactly what you feel when you sleep at Sandat: unique place in the middle of rice field in magic Ubud. You wont find a hotel like this anywhere in Bali.
 
You have all the comfort in the tents. So, it looks like you are camping but in a beautiful bed with a very charming bathroom… it really looks like home, but surrounded by rice fields, facing the jungle.
Tents are beautifully decorated with lots of nice details. Beds and linens are great, and the private pool that every tent has, is also great for relax after some shopping at Ubud Market.

The amazing gardens that surround the tents are carefully planted, so you wont forget where you are - in the jungle!
The hotel is very well designed and all tents are really private and enclosed by plants that will hide you from the other tents. 

The restaurant, all made of gigantic bamboo is stunning. Also here the decoration is unique, like he bamboo structure.
Breakfast is very nice, with homemade jams, homemade breads and cakes, etc - very healthy and organic! Delicious.

We just showed up at the hotel lobby. We had no reservation, but the staff was very helpfull and we got lucky because there were one available tent for 2 nights and 1 bungallow.

We also reccomend the Bungallows (Lumbung style). Here you don’t have the private pool. Pool is shared for 3 Bungallows.
But you get a 2 storey Bungallow. Room on top where you will slepp like a princess, and opened air living room at the bottom, and this is the best part of the Bungallow: this “chill” area is great, for your afternoon tea, while you listen to the jungle sounds. It is just perfect… to lay down here, and listen to the frogs, the geckos, the ducks, and all the birds… 
If tents are full, dont hesitate to book in the Lumbungs. You wont regret.

All the staff is very nice, as all Balinese are!
The owners Roberto and Frederico are totally there for you, explaining and showing everything about their Hotel, making you feel like home!
They even borrowed us their motorbike! Really, really the best hotel owners you can get to meet.

Sandat is around 5-10 minutes (motorbike) from central Ubud.
 
It is an amazing place, and you will feel it as soon as you enter the main gate.
We definitely recommend it!
title: Sandat became our favourite hotel

text: Sandat Glamping is just BRILLIANT. The kids loved the main swimming pool and the landscape. Us parents loved the feeling of deep peace, and the understated luxury. Campari and soda! Fresh honeycomb for breakfast! Very good (for Ubud) wifi! Natural materials! We worried our tent would be too small, but it was perfect for a family of four. Very well appointed bathroom, roomy sleeping area, and we had our own (small) infinity pool with a gobsmackingly beautiful view over the forest. The food is wonderful - simple but pleasing - served in a spectacular reception / dining area. Great staff, very charming owners. Sandat Glamping is stunning and we were sad to leave!
title: hard to beat!

text: What a wonderful piece of paradise!  A unique experience that should definitely be tried!  Tengo and the team were always very helpful, the tents are beautiful and the common areas are amazing.  The tents are roomy and comfortable.  We really enjoyed waking to the sounds of the wildlife.  There are only 5 tents, so it will never be a really crowded place.  The breakfast was perfect, fresh juice, fresh jams and fresh baked goods from a local bakery were very enjoyable and filling.  A shuttle is available to take you into town to enjoy everything that Ubud has to offer. Be prepared for a little bit of rough road driving through the rice fields.  There is a limited dinner menu available at Sandat and if you want the special menu, you have to give them a one day notice, so eat in town and relax at Sandat!!  Ubud is a must visit when in Bali and there are many lodging options, but if you are looking for that extraordinary place to stay then choose Sandat Glamping!
title: A piece of paradise

text: We stayed for one night in one of their private pool tents. It’s been such an amazing experience. The tents are very private and not overlooked. We had a couples massage which was absolutely amazing and the tent itself offered a unique stay with a round bed, a shower outside and inside. It’s super quiet and perfect for those looking to recharge their batteries. They offer various activities and yoga at 7am every morning. The breakfast does not disappoint either. Everyone is very friendly to make your stay a wonderful experience. We will definitely come back and next time for longer to make the most of it.
title: Tranquility and relaxation

text:
It's hard to pick a hotel out of the many that offer this kind of accommodation in Ubud. They look quite similar, usually offering a cozy room with a forest view and an infinity pool, but what I liked about Sandat in particular was how it blends with the surroundings.

Firstly it's a tent. It's a luxury tent, so the comfort is as good as it gets. And the advantage is that the room is basically open to the outside, so your just separated of the nature only by nets (it's possible to close the "windows" but we liked to keep it open the whole time, even at night. 

Then you have the private pool. The outside area with the quite large pool and loungers is just amazing. And you can't actually see other people or the hotel areas, so the sense of relaxation is unique. The outside shower was a great plus.

The room is also really cozy and nicely decorated, and they offer a huge daily basket of fruits. Only the shower curtains you need to get used to, but it's also not bad. Good AC but we mostly used just the fan. Breakfast is amazing: they offer a small buffet with delicious bread, cakes and fruits, you can order your eggs, and on the table they put handmade jams.

The service was also great and they offer a shuttle bus to the center any time you need.

In general it was an amazing experience worth trying.

text: I recently stayed at the Sandat Glamping Tents and had such an amazing time. It's a MUST DO if you are in Bali. title: PURE MAGIC.

text: We just spent three days at Sandat Glamping Tents and came back in love with this place. The resort is made up of eight luxury tents, each with their own private pools, ten minutes drive from the centre of Ubud. It would be hard to find a more romantic hotel, affording ultimate privacy and serenity, in Bali. The tents are divine, the grounds superbly kept, the staff super friendly and the food (a mix of Italian and Balinese) is excellent. If you add a wonderful yoga teacher and delightful massages on your private tent terrace, you come up with the perfect retreat in Ubud. We can only give the highest ratings across the board to Sandat Glamping. Well done Federico and the team!
title: Beautiful romantic setting in Bali

text: Incredible experience, I would stay here over a hotel any day of the week. Premium experience, private pool, air conditioning, delicious buffet breakfast, attentive staff. I cant wait to return. Highly recommended.
title: Better than a hotel

text: Loved every inch of the Sandat Glamping Tents! The rooms are well kept with beautiful upcycled Balinese furniture heirlooms combined with luxury linens, every inch had a feeling of home. Stayed in the Lumboc house. We used both separate beds (1 double, 1 twin), both had mosquito nets. The house is spacious with outdoor bathroom and lounge area downstairs, sleeping area is upstairs. The pool is only shared with 2 other Lumboc houses and no one was ever at it, so it felt private. I took a private yoga class by the hotel’s instructor and it was fantastic! We also ate dinner one night at the hotel and the Balinese food was just as good if not better than at a restaurant in town. The resort also has a private shuttle to take you into town. It is hidden down a private dirt road, so your private driver may have trouble finding it, but it is definitely a hidden gem! Will definitely be coming back! ❤️
title: Unique/Boho Chic Resort - Must Stay!

text: This place is really special and unique. We’ve spent 5 nights in the Ogoh Ogoh tent which is truly amazing, beautifully decorated and also extremely peaceful and relaxing. The villa is surrounded by trees and you feel like you’re in the jungle. Private pool is pretty big and deep enough to swim. The design of the dining area is also spectacular, the stuff is super friendly and helpful.
title: Unique

text: This is the only way to see Ubud.  I was in Ubud over 20 years ago and there is no doubt it has grown exponentially.  Full of bustle and charm still but avoid rush hour. Sandat is a sanctuary away from this, run by a Venetian Italian, it is boutique luxury, delicious food, a choice between the comfortable rice barns or canvas, staff well trained and the in house massages second to none. We visited the Chedi and Ritz Carlton hotels but they are large and soulless. Sandat brings you far closer to Bali and we wouldn’t hesitate to return.  Charlie H

text:
We stayed here as our last stop in Bali to finish our honeymoon trip. 

The postives are the lovely tents and vibes in the resort. 

The breakfast buffet was pleasant and also accommodating to our dietary restrictions and well as the lunch and dinner menu ( though over priced for Bali standards) 

The city center is not a far ride away and they provide free shuttle services at 2 different  locations. 

I'm giving this place a 4 rather then a 5 because of how payment was processed being charged a high international fee and since payment was processed twice that high fee was charged twice, which owner said we would get back ( amongst  initial argument upon our arrival) we never did get that back .. its not really about the money as you pay high price for staying here but that left a bitter taste.
title: Peaceful short car ride to city center.

text:
Quite difficult to write a review about the Sandat Glamping.
The positive :
The resort is really nice. Balinese ambiance with a modern touch, the first approach is great.
We stayed in one of the barn, lovely with not a single doubt.
The “could do better” :
The service, although effective, is too formal. Lack of warmth. For such a small property and with the natural kindness of Balinese people, we are expecting a more genuine approach from them.
Although Buda (don’t know the spelling) was very nice.
Another aspect where they could improve, for example, is the absence of sleepers and bathrobe... might look unnecessary for some but considering your room is on the first floor and the bathroom on the ground floor with potentially people seeing directly on the entrance of your bathroom, this would have been welcomed.
Reception should know better the activities they suggest, this would avoid some disappointment.
This place has the potential to be better if they give a more personal and genuine service to their guests.
On another side, even if the barns are really charming, consider that you hear your neighbors very easily.... enthusiastic honeymooners, you shall consider the tents instead.
title: Mixed feelings

text:
This is my 3rd visit to Ubud, I was looking for an authentic, luxurious boutique stay and I certainly found it here..

My previous stays in Ubud have been the Samaya and the Viceroy which were amazing however Sabdat Glamping offered a truly unique experience set within working rice fields 

We stayed in both the tent and the traditional style accommodation and loved both for different reasons.. the deco is luxurious with a real bohemian feel - accommodation setting really reminded me of my safari trip, waking up listening to the surrounding nature but at a fraction of the cost 

Attention to detail is second to none, the Manager Tengo goes over and beyond to ensure you have a magical stay.. we wanted to try yoga for the first time but was slightly aprehseive as we were beginners but he reassured us to try it out and have the most amazing experience..

Dining area was stunning, we ate here a couple of times and can totally recommend 

Ubud has become busier over the years however I feel staying here truly made our stay very authentic away from the tourism 

We will certainly return

text: The tent we stayed at in Sandat Glamping is by far the most luxurious tent we have ever seen. Calling it a tent is in fact almost an understatement, as it is more akin to a villa. The bed was super comfortable to sleep in, and the temperature was perfect without any air conditioning throughout both the day and night. There is electricity inside as well as a bathroom - which, should be noted, wasn't very private with just a curtain between it and the "bedroom". The area outside the tent was gorgeous with two sunbeds and a private pool overlooking the jungle. Falling asleep to the sounds of the jungle was a great experience, and we very much enjoyed stargazing from the starbeds late at night. The breakfast buffet wasn't particularly extensive, but all the offerings were of high-quality. As vegans, buffets like this one can prove boring affairs, but thankfully, this wasn't the case. We had toasted bread with local jams, vegan nasi goreng (fried rice with vegetables), Balinese coffee and delicious muesli with fresh tropical fruits and coconut milk. Sandat Glamping's location is about 15 minutes of scooter riding away from the center of Ubud, yet still very peaceful and a world away from the hustle and bustle of town. Be aware that the last bit of road before Sandat isn't paved and can be a bit bumpy. The service was great and we felt taken very well care of throughout the stay!
title: Luxurious glamping

text:
Well, what can I say about Glamping Sandat? It was incredible!

My boyfriend and I stayed 2 nights here in the luxury tent and had the best time!
It was our first-time 'glamping' and we'll definitely be doing it again. 

Service:
The service was amazing. We loved all the little details like ringing an instrument when if you need room service as they do not use telephones. The staff also ring a bell before they enter your tent area so you can allow them to enter. 

Tent:
The tent was beautiful. Very spacious and we especially liked the circular bed. You can tell a lot of thought has been put into the decoration and style of the whole resort. 
The private pool was perfect with views of the jungle/rice terrace. 

Food:
We only tried the breakfast during our stay but everything we tried was delicious. The buffet has a good selection and you can also choose to have eggs cooked any way you like.
The actual dining area/bar is breathtakingly beautiful too! 

Overall, we loved our stay here and 100% recommend to anyone coming to Ubud.

Jack and Becky

text:
We stayed in 8 resorts in Bali and this hotel is the worst. The price and the service are not congruent. The cost of 4.7 millions tent for one night for 3 persons does not go along with the normal Balinese service standard.

Tent: Besides shampoo and shower gel, no other basic bathroom amenities were provided. Manager or Indonesia Co-Owner excused this morning that a shower cap is on request but his staff last night said that they did not have it.

Buffet Breakfast: low quality food. Very limited choices for normal 4 stars. For example, there was no ham bacon sausages. Only eggs were available. They put MOLDY natural interwoven materials on the water glasses on the dining table. Yoghurt was put outside and it’s not cold. Papaya juice smelt like rotten papaya. For tiny jam jars, they served you the already opened ones by other guests. You don’t know if people before you used a separate knife for it. There were insects flying above the fresh fruit and I found 1 insect dying in the yoghurt jar.

Staff: staffs tried to be nice but mamager / indonesian co-owner did not know how to deal with basic guest enquiries. Instead, he raised the voice / shouted back at us. He denied all our questions about the service operations.  He said his glamping is by his own rules and it cannot be compared to other hotels but what is the hotel-star classification for? We didn’t see the Italian owner but they should change a manager if this Indonesian guy can’t be a leader that has a service mind. His attitude really failed.

In summary, Sandat Glamping is way too far for being value for money, for being a 4-star resort.
title: They should the management.

text: Location is great for anyone looking to get a little away from the center of UBUD. Rice paddies all around which through you get the true feeling of UBUD. Does glamorous camping justice. Hot water in bathroom does need improvement as well as the toilets. The breakfast spread is not vegetarian/vegan friendly unless requested from day before. Quality of breakfast is average. Staff and service is great. Tents are great.
title: Different experience

text: A very special place. Close enough to Ubud city but far enough to get away from all the hustle and bustle. We enjoyed our stay very much and started every morning with a yoga class. Great location, friendly staff, great food. We loved it.
title: Paradise

text:
My husband and I stayed for a week last month and we cannot fault the place. 
We were greeted so warmly by all the staff and they couldn’t do enough for us throughout our stay. 
We stayed in the Oogoh Oogoh tent and it such a wonderful experience. Sleeping to all of the sounds of the jungle every night was magical and the privacy and tranquility by our private pool in the day was exactly what we’d hoped for. 
We dined at the restaurant often and the food was delicious. Our highlights were the crispy duck and the spare ribs. 
The hotel will arrange for massages by your pool and you really must try this at least once during your stay. We had two. 
Many thanks to Buda, Tengo and the rest of the team for making us feel right at home.
title: Just Perfect

text:
Nothing glamerous nor camping about this resort. Just a moldy and dusty tent without any view and ownership without any feeling for proper hospitality. 

We have been living in Bali for more then 9 years now and have stayed at all the luxurious resorts in Bali.

So when we heard about sandat we were really excited that we would celebrate our wedding anniversary inthere.

Prior to our arrival I had send an email to them asking for special package in relation to the celebration as I am used that I get excellent service here in Bali. 

We decided to go by our own car as we live in Bali. (terrible idea as the road there is absolutely awful). However after a long ride we were happy we arrived and we ready to receive the 5 star treatment the resort claims to have. But the opposite was true. We arrived by car and everyone seemed confused of what to do. No smiles no grating just a weird awkward moment. Noone offering to help with luggage untill we asked nothing. So we felt strange why do they act weird. We eventually got to the check in part which got even more awkward with many unnecessary and questions and reconfirmation of payments which were already been taken care of prior to the check-in date. As we were traveling with 2 kids 5 and 7 we were asked to provide identity(never been asked anywhere else before) we genuinely forgot to bring there ID as we are traveling locally but are accused of not wanted to provide ID because of extra payment. Honestly money is not the issue. We told them my oldest is 7 and they showed a piece of paper saying untill 7 not paid. The worker herself said no need for payment at that point. 

After this experience we were thinking let's just get to the tent and get over it. But when we arrived it was just not what we expected. There was no view the tent was just hot and muffy dusty and molded. Seeing this we just decided that we were not happy and asked for a refund of the second night. 

The manager instructed us to email the owners with the complained and wait for their decision. 

So we did and went into ubud as the resort was just not comfortable anymore.

That night we stayed the night and we just couldn't get a good night rest as we were provided with really thin blankets and a very hard bed. (not the standard I'm used to from a luxurious resort).

The next morning we spoke with the manager and he offered only 50 percent of the 2nd night. Which for us was just not acceptable. So he said he will still need to wait for the owners response. 

We went once again into ubud(which one shouldn't have to when booking a luxurious resort). We finally received a email refusing to give the refund of the second night. 

Instead we were accused of lies and accusations that we refused to show ID. Which we clearly explained we didn't bring because usually we don't need it. 

Actually my wife had put a review on this website before and was again accused of lies and claiming to have offered us more then they have actually done. 

Therefore for me these kind of people do not deserve a good review for their lack of compassion for their customers. 

For us money had never been the issue. Not to brag but we booked a yacht for my wife's birthday. As long as its worth it I don't mind to spend. But this resort is just simply not worth it. I hope when you read this that you will search abit further as bali has so much more to offer with much better resorts. 

Therefore to keep the quality of bali up please do not support these kind of resorts.
title: Many more much greater places in Bali

owner_response.text:
We do not know how to interpret the two reviews issued by the same couple of guests. 
It is difficult to respond to criticism without foundation. 
The excellent reviews expressed by Customers satisfied and fascinated by Sandat Glamping tents and his Staff respond by themselves.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We paid 7.3 million for 2 nights, moment we arrived no one greet us, i smile, i tried to shake hand to bring the happy feeling, no smile from the receptionist still, instead they looking at me weird don’t feel welcome at all, they ask passports from my young children ( why? Like i bring their passport everywhere, i live in here and They’re indonesian!) room is small, swimming pool small, we choose sarong room btw, bed also small i think it’s only queen bed,  we arrived in the room and the room
Really warm, they expected us to come but we feel no welcome at all! Hotel have nothing but room and restaurant,  Wish i can ask refund i can spend that price at many other luxury options here in ubud or other glamping experience!
title: Avoid this place at any cost!! Unless you dont mind wasting your money.

owner_response.text:
Dear Customer,
we are sorry to read your words, above all because they hide the true reason for your dissatisfaction that does not depend on us.

Our staff - much appreciated for the kindness and the unfailing smile documented by the dozens of reviews that precede yours - asked you the identity documents of your family because every hotel has the obligation to make known the presence to the local police: this is a rule that all hotels must respect and that is valid for all guests, none excluded.

Probably this practice has annoyed you because you did not want to show your children's documents that, having more than 7 years, they would have to pay a small price.
But you wanted to make them believe they are under 6 years old.

In any case we have not charged the additional cost for children.

The Tent was booked for 2 people (wedding anniversary with set of flowers-pool) but You arrived with the whole family of 4 pax without informing us and our Staff, quickly and kindly, arranged two extra beds even if the Room Category admitted a maximum of 1 extra bed.
For your family of 4 you should have booked the Suite category that can accommodate up to 4 people.

Despite all this, in any case, to allow you to change hotels, we offered you a free stay for 2 children and a 50% refund for the second night ( you already spend 1 night) but you demanded a refund of both nights otherwise you would have issued a bad review.

We do not accept these systems and we do not fear this type of reviews.

Our Glamping offers luxurious air-conditioned tents, a private pool and a large yoga studio, restaurant and lounge area. All this is described in detail on the website.
If you were expecting to find a playground for children, maybe you made a mistake when you chose where to stay.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We stayed 6 days with my husband at Sandat glamping resort. It is simply the definition of modern luxury: great taste on every single little detail, almost zero impact on the surrounding (stunning) environment, friendly but at the same extremely discreet personnel. If Bali, I mean the real Bali, is your next destination this is the best way to get close to the real spirit of this beautiful island.
We will keep the memory of this beautiful vacations for a very long time. Thank you Sandat.
title: The definition of modern luxury

text:
There’s a little piece of paradise in the emerald green paddy fields outside Ubud in Bali. Real safari tents from South Africa are set on wooden decks in lush forest enclaves, with the emphasis on privacy and relaxation, 
The tents are beautifully appointed with both ceiling fans and air conditioning, iPod sound system and an em-suite bathroom.
We lazed on sun loungers alongside our private pool for the first few days, before making use of the free shuttle service to visit bustling Ubud. 
Breakfast is included, and we ate dinner several nights in the amazing bamboo dining room. Food was varied and very well prepared - the fresh salads in particular - and the service attentive and charming.
Overall a superb break and highly recommended.
title: A little piece of paradise

text:
My stay at Sandat was my first time glamping and an experience that I'm going to remember forever. From the moment my partner and I arrived, our luggage was taking care of whilst we checked ourselves in. The receptionist was attentive to our needs and ensured the procedure went as smooth and as swiftly as possible. We were then shown to our tent which was just incredible!
From the bedroom, to the bathroom, to even our own 'sexy shower', we felt like royalty. From then onwards, all our requests were met by the superb staff members. The grounds were kept in magnificent condition and the food was amazing; if you have a chance to try the chef's special 'trio of fish' I strongly recommend it - best fish I've ever had!
If ever I decide to go glamping again in Bali, I'll definitely be choosing Sandat Glamping Tents, there's no doubt about it!
title: Best Glamping Experience Ever!

text: Sandat Glamping Tents is the best place and most unique in Ubud. We stayed there for 3 nights and we have enjoyed every secend of our stay. The staff at Sandat is the most friendly, happy and helpfull people we have seen in a long time. They take care of you and the serounding nature. We have stayed in one of the tents with a private pool and we loved waiting up to the sound of birds and going to bed with the view on the forest and candel lights. We also took a massage near our pool which we defintly recommend. The restaurant is also great with a wide variety of food, drinks and wines. Have I said that the staff is the best? I will say it again! Thank you for hosting us and hope to see you soon 😍
title: Totaly in love!

text: We adored Sandat, which is super glam camping. Our exquisitely styled safari tent had a private plunge and divine sunbeds. It was so comfortable that it is more like a luxury hotel transplanted into rural Ubud. The restaurant is tres chic, too with a curved wall adorned with 101 mirrors. The food was fab, so we ate in a lot. The glamping site is about five minutes outside of Ubud but in the middle of the beautiful Bali with rice paddies and jungle. Don't be put off by the bumpy dirt road getting there because it delivers you to paradise. The staff we well trained and very helpful without getting in the way. There is a sunrise yoga shala and a larger shared pool where complimentary water is constantly being delivered. My god, this is a beautiful place set into a stunningly beautiful environment. The tent interiors and the restaurant, which is like a bamboo cathedral are like they have fallen from the cover of Vogue Homes and despite all this exquisite style, Sandat has a very welcoming and chilled vibe. It has little nooks in which to retreat and daybeds overlooking a very beautiful cactus garden. The hosts are Italian so expect great coffee and fantastic pasta while the chef is local so the local food is of a very high standard and worth more than one try. The breakfast was a gorgeous affair with dishes cooked to order and a small and pretty buffet with no less than six different types of honey to choose from including local coffee honey and others from tropical fruits and flowers. We just loved this place - even my usually cranky teen was in a world of her own that was full of beauty and bliss. I call it barefoot luxury. Apparently the owners have another glamping retreat just outside of Venice and I want to go there ... maybe next year.
title: Super glam style

owner_response.text:
Dear Ondzz, 
It has been a pleasure to have you as guests at Sandat Glamping Tents and we are happy to have contributed to make enjoyable your stay in the beautiful island of Bali.  With the sincere hope to see you again here at Sandat or in Italy at our other Glamping Canonici Di San Marco - Venice, we send you our very best regards.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: What a stunning place Sandat is right in the middle of a traditional Balinese landscape with rice paddies and farming life. We woke up to the gentle quacking of lovely ducks just on the other side of a high and beautiful bamboo fence. Sandat is true glamping . Our exquisitely decorated safari tent had a private plunge pool. It's really like a small exclusive hotel but dropped into the countryside. The sounds of birds and the breeze was incredibly refreshing. The night sky is super clear so look up and star gaze - it's us breathtaking.The restaurant is in a big bamboo structure and so superbly decorated with a wall hung with 101 mirrors of different shapes and sizes. A long communal dining table is fun for breakfast but there are a scattering of other tables for those who want privacy - we used both. I loved the library lounge with the chess table where the kids played quietly and I read after dinner. The staff also played choice music like Nina Simone, too. Sandat is only five or so minutes from central Ubud but it feels like a million miles away from anywhere. Our host Frederico was bouncing around at sunset making sure everyone had Sandat signature Spritz on the house. Great hospitality and excellent pasta. I loved that is it a small place so within a day guests are greeting each other with a happy smile. Everyone is chilled and relaxed and why wouldn't you be staying in this quiet and stylish place? Another gorgeous touch is the wait staff constantly appearing with big jugs of iced water infused with mint and citrus to keep you fully hydrated. This was a pleasant surprise because we had to buy plastic bottled water in just about every restaurant and cafe that we visited in Bali. Thank you Sandat for true hospitality and for being kind to the earth. We will definitely be back!
title: Chic and fabulous

owner_response.text: t has been a pleasure to have you as guests at Sandat Glamping Tents and we are happy to have contributed - with our green-philosophy and italian style interior decoration - to make enjoyable your stay in the beautiful island of Bali.  The Staff would like to thank you for the nice words you wrote about us which reward the passion and the effort we dedicate every day to the hospitality.  With the sincere hope to see you again here at Sandat or in Italy at our other Glamping Canonici Di San Marco - Venice, we send you our very best regards.  The Direction

text:
This property wants to be seen as a luxury "hotel"  but in fact it is not at all. It is only an overpriced special concept (glamping) experience. If you would like to stay in a tent which is eco friendly but can skip the luxury feeling go for it. Otherwise it is not the best choice, far away from our expectations.

 - breakfast is very poor and far away from the pictures

 - had to ask 3 times per day for complimentary water
